title: Panic at Kabul airport as Taliban besiege Afghan capital
description: New videos show panicked mobs at Kabul International Airport as hundreds try to flee the besieged Afghan capital as Taliban forces move in.

title: What will an Afghanistan under the Taliban look like?
description: In late 2001, the rolling hills to the west of Afghanistan's Maidan Shahr were scarred with the black eruptions of high explosives, as the last few Taliban fighters were pounded by Northern Alliance artillery and American bombers. Then, as suddenly as a thunderclap, silence fell on the battlefield.

title: See Kevin Hart's hilariously awkward reaction to Don Cheadle's age
description: During an interview on the show "Hart to Heart," host Kevin Hart seemed legitimately shocked when he learned how old actor Don Cheadle was, but the moment was not as bad as it seemed.

title: Biden officials admit miscalculation as Afghan government falls
description: President Joe Biden and his administration struggled Sunday to project order amid a race by American and other foreign personnel to evacuate Afghanistan as Taliban fighters entered Kabul.

title: More than 1,200 dead and thousands injured after Haiti earthquake
Coronavirus has created the perfect conditions for a full-scale war on truth
Singer and songwriter Nanci Griffith has died at 68
description: Folk and country singer and songwriter Nanci Griffith, whose album "Other Voices, Other Rooms" won the 1994 Grammy Award for Best Contemporary Folk Album, died on Friday. She was 68.

title: No star striker, no problem as Tottenham Hotspur stuns Manchester City
description: No Harry Kane? No problem. Tottenham Hotspur stunned Manchester City on Sunday, grinding out a gritty 1-0 win, despite the absence of the London's club star striker, who has been linked with a move to the reigning Premier League champion.

title: Top US general says terror groups could reconstitute in Afghanistan sooner than expected
description: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark Milley said Sunday in a briefing for Senators that terrorist groups like al Qaeda could reconstitute in Afghanistan sooner than the two years defense officials had previously estimated to Congress because of the recent, rapid Taliban takeover of the country, according to a Senate aide briefed on the comments.

title: Muhammad Ali's grandson marks professional boxing debut with a victory
description: The continuation of a legacy was how Nico Ali Walsh -- the grandson of Muhammad Ali -- described making his professional boxing debut in the sport on Saturday.

title: The US and Canada have a new dark sky park for stargazers to enjoy
description: Amateur astronomers take note: There's a new dark sky place to see the stars.

title: Gerd Müller: Legendary Bayern Munich striker mourned after death, aged 75
description: German soccer great Gerd Müller, who scored a remarkable 566 goals in 607 competitive appearances for Bayern Munich, died on Sunday at the age of 75, according to the Bundesliga club.

title: Death toll from Turkey floods rises to 58
description: Flash floods across Turkey's Black Sea coast have killed 58 people, officials said Sunday.

title: San Antonio sports bar shooting leaves 3 dead, 2 wounded, authorities say
description: An argument between two people at a bar in San Antonio, Texas, ended in a mass shooting early Sunday, with three people killed and two others gravely wounded, San Antonio Police Chief William McManus said.

title: More than a year later, America grapples with long Covid
description: "I was told to go home and rest, that everything would be fine in two weeks. Sadly, those two weeks for me have never come," said Chimére Smith, 39, one of many Americans fighting long Covid.

title: This $4.7 million racer will likely be Bugatti's last gas-powered supercar
description: Bugatti announced that it will be making a production version of its concept car called the Bolide, an 1,800-horsepower, 16-cylinder track-only supercar with a top speed of over 300 miles per hour. And this will likely be the last gasoline-powered car the French automaker will build.

title: Obama poses a question that we still cannot answer
description: The "Yes We Can!" bumper sticker that seemed to be plastered on every passing car. The "fired up, ready to go!" chant that once rocked arenas.

title: Why we can't get enough of watching rich and terrible characters in TV series like 'The White Lotus'
description: There's a scene in the very first episode of HBO's critically acclaimed prestige drama, "Succession," that is about as viscerally unsettling to watch as a Jigsaw death trap in a "Saw" film.

title: Homophobic chanting mars Premier League win
description: Hundreds of thousands of fans attended English Premier League matches this weekend for the first time in nearly 18 months, though one game was marred by homophobic chanting and another by "isolated incidents of disorder" ahead of kick off.

title: A look at the Trans-Iranian Railway, one of the 20th century's greatest engineering feats
description: It may not be as long or as well-known as Russia's iconic Trans-Siberian Railway. But international recognition is long overdue for the 1,394-kilometer (865-mile) Trans-Iranian Railway.

title: Naomi Osaka to donate prize money to Haitian earthquake relief efforts
description: Naomi Osaka has pledged to donate her earnings from next week's Western & Southern Open to support earthquake relief efforts in Haiti, the Caribbean nation her father hails from.

title: 'If the Taliban find me, they will kill me and my family,' says abandoned Afghan interpreter
description: It's been years since Haji and his wife have had a good night's sleep.

title: The deployment comes as the Taliban seizes land with breathtaking speed. Only two major cities remain in the government's control.
description:
• CNN reporter enters former US base captured by the Taliban
• The Taliban 'will kill me and my family,' says abandoned Afghan interpreter

title: The mysterious Chinese fashion app that's as popular as Amazon
Biden sending more troops to Afghanistan
